# Chord: 9th in A# (Shape: E)

## Brief Presentation
The 9th chord in A# (also known as Bb) with an E shape is a rich and colorful chord that adds depth and texture to musical compositions. This chord is constructed by combining the notes A#, C#, E#, G#, and B#. The ninth tone (B#) adds a sense of tension and dissonance to the chord, creating a lush and sophisticated sound.

## Notes and Intervals
- A#: The root note of the chord
- C#: The major third
- E#: The fifth
- G#: The dominant seventh
- B#: The ninth (or second, one octave higher)

The intervals in this chord are:
- Root to major third: Major third interval
- Root to fifth: Perfect fifth interval
- Root to dominant seventh: Minor seventh interval
- Root to ninth: Major ninth interval

## Musical Flavor and Genre
The 9th chord in A# with an E shape has a jazzy and soulful flavor to it. It is commonly used in jazz, R&B, and soul music to add color and complexity to chord progressions. The tension created by the ninth tone can evoke emotions and add a sense of sophistication to musical arrangements.

## 3 Songs Using the Chord
1. **"Feeling Good" by Nina Simone**: This jazz classic features the 9th chord in A# (E shape) in its captivating chord progressions, enhancing the dramatic and powerful emotions conveyed in the song.
   
2. **"I Say a Little Prayer" by Aretha Franklin**: In this soulful hit, the 9th chord in A# (E shape) is used to create lush and harmonically rich sections, contributing to the emotional depth of the song.

3. **"So What" by Miles Davis**: This iconic jazz composition showcases the versatility of the 9th chord in A# (E shape) in creating atmospheric and expressive musical landscapes, characteristic of classic jazz improvisation.
